intro: Viguiera hypargyrea, commonly known as the silverleaf coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features silvery-gray foliage that provides a striking contrast to its bright yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping. Viguiera hypargyrea is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
